FuncDef:
The least active-linknumber command sets the minimum number (lower threshold) of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state.
The undo least active-linknumber command restores the default minimum number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state.
By default, the minimum number of IP-Trunk member links is 1. That is, the IP-Trunk interface requires at least one active link to work.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the minimum number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 64.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state affects the status and bandwidth of an IP-Trunk interface. To maintain stability, you can set the minimum number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state to reduce the impact of the status change on the IP-Trunk interface.
To set the minimum number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state, you can run the least active-linknumber command. To restore the default minimum number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state, you can run the undo least active-linknumber command.
Prerequisites
An IP-Trunk interface has been configured.
Configuration Impact
After the minimum number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state is set:
When the number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state is less than the lower threshold, the IP-Trunk interface goes Down.When the number of IP-Trunk member links in the Up state reaches the lower threshold, the IP-Trunk interface goes Up.

Precautions
If the least active-linknumber command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
To ensure normal forwarding, it is recommended that the same lower threshold be configured for the IP-Trunk interfaces on both ends of the same IP-Trunk link.
This command is mutually exclusive with the least active-bandwidth bandwidth command. Check that the least active-bandwidth bandwidth command configuration does not exist before running this command.
